unnormalised: ## Payment Gateways: Because Nobody Wants to Count Rupees Anymore!
normalised: ## Payment Gateways: Because Nobody Wants to Count Rupees Anymore!

unnormalised: So, you’re thinking of opening your own online samosa shop, or maybe finally selling those hand-knitted sweaters your auntie, Lakshmi aunty, keeps making? Fantastic! But hold on, before you dream of sipping chai on a beach in Goa with your newfound riches, you gotta tackle the beast that is: *payment gateways*.
normalised: So, you’re thinking of opening your own online samosa shop, or maybe finally selling those hand-knitted sweaters your auntie, Lakshmi aunty, keeps making? Fantastic! But hold on, before you dream of sipping chai on a beach in Goa with your newfound riches, you gotta tackle the beast that is: payment gateways.

unnormalised: Think of payment gateways like the friendly neighbourhood kirana store uncle, but instead of handing over crumpled Rs. 50 notes, your customers are virtually sliding over their credit card details (safely, of course!). They're the invisible helpers that make sure the money from, say, Rohan in Pune, makes its way to your bank account without any drama. Nobody wants to manually transfer money anymore, right? Ain't nobody got time for that! Especially during Diwali rush.

unnormalised: Choosing the right one is like picking the perfect biryani recipe – too spicy, and you'll scare away the delicate palates; too bland, and nobody will remember it. There's Razorpay, PayU, CC Avenue – they all promise smooth transactions and competitive rates. Do your homework, folks! Check those transaction fees (those sneaky little devils!), and make sure they integrate with your platform, whether it's Shopify, WooCommerce, or your cousin's slightly dodgy custom-built website (we've all been there).

unnormalised: Imagine launching your Onam Sadhya delivery service and your payment gateway crashes. Total disaster! You'd be swimming in unsold appams and have angry customers flooding your inbox faster than you can say "Narayana Narayana."

unnormalised: Security is key, like locking up your gold jewelry during wedding season. Make sure they're PCI DSS compliant, which basically means they’re keeping your customer’s data safe and sound. Nobody wants their card details ending up in the wrong hands – that's worse than finding a cockroach in your masala dosa.
